alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Howard; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ANDREWS... SOUTHEASTERN GAINES...SOUTHWESTERN BORDEN...WESTERN HOWARD...MARTIN AND SOUTHERN DAWSON COUNTIES THROUGH 500 AM CDT... At 421 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Lamesa to 15 miles west of Lenorah. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Lamesa, Ackerly, Stanton, Lomax, Lenorah, Luther, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Los Ybanez, Tarzan, Sparenberg, Patricia, Tenmile, Knott, Vealmoor, Stanton Municipal Aiport, Key, Klondike, and Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 154 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
